Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 5, 2003 be adopted and printed by Council Member Monserrate.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Monserrate moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 5, 2003 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Housing and Buildings
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to area eligibility limitations on benefits pursuant to section 421-a of the real property tax law.
Items.MatterName: Area eligibility limitations on benefits pursuant to section 421-a of the real property tax law.

Items.Title: Resolution opposing President Bush's FY 2004 budget proposal to eliminate the Section 8 Housing Voucher Choice program and replace it with block grants to the States and calling upon the New York State Congressional Delegation to oppose bills H.R. 1841 and S. 947, which would implement this proposal.
Items.MatterName: Opposing President Bush's FY 2004 budget proposal to eliminate the Section 8 Housing Voucher Choice program.

Items.Title: Resolution to amend the contract between the City of New York and Mutual Redevelopment Houses, Inc. (1) to allow the Housing Company to impose a capital assessment of $960 per room payable in a period of 48 months beginning July 1, 2003 and (2) to modify the language with regards to succession and occupancy rights in the Housing Company.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amend contract between NYC and Mutual Redevelopment Houses, Inc.

Items.Title: Communication from the Department of Housing Preservation and Development - Submitting request from Mutual Redevelopment Houses, Inc., (Penn South) to seek approval from the Council, pursuant to Private Housing Finance Law Sections 114 and 125 for certain changes.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Filed by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: HPD Submitting request from Mutual Redevelopment Houses, Inc.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Communication from the Mayor  -  "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the number of intersections at which traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices may be installed and reporting upon the use of a traffic-control signal photo-monitoring system and to amend chapter 746 of the laws of 1988, amending the vehicle and traffic law, the general municipal law and the public officers law, relating to the civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend local law number 46 of the city of New York for the year 1989, amending the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic control signal violations, in relation to the duration of the application of provisions of such code, such chapter and such law." A.4806-A / S.2472-A
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Traffic control signal photo-monitoring devices. (A.4806-A, S.2472-A)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to discontinue the use of certain lands as park lands.  A.8069-C/S.4791-C
Items.MatterName: Discontinue the use of certain lands as park lands. (A.8069-C/S.4791-C)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills, introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1182, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.2844, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to deputy sheriffs of the city of New York who are incapacitated in the performance of their duties".
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Deputy sheriffs who are incapacitated in the performance of their duties (S.1182, A.2844)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Abbate, A.4895, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed in police communications positions; and in relation to providing for employer pick up, pursuant to provisions of the internal revenue code, of certain additional member contributions required to be made by certain participants in the twenty-five year retirement programs".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the NYCERS employed in police communications positions (A.4895)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.3836, and Assembly Members Abbate, Lavelle, Cymbrowitz and Seddio, et al, A.7190, "AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to provisional appointments".
Items.MatterName: Provisional appointments (S.3836, A.7190)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Velella, S.4962, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed in police communications positions; and in relation to providing for employer pick up, pursuant to provisions of the internal revenue code, of certain additional member contributions required to be made by certain participants in the twenty-five year retirement programs".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the NYC employees' retirement system employed in police communications positions (S.4962)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4717, and Committee on Rules, A.8371, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the industrial and commercial incentive program".
Items.MatterName: Industrial and commercial incentive program (S.4717, A.8371)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.2669, and Committee on Rules, A.8588, "AN ACT in relation to authorizing the city of New York to sell real property consisting of vacant land owned by such city known as Bennett's Lane in the borough of Brooklyn designated as Block 6362, Lot 100 on the tax map of the city of New York for the borough of Brooklyn and property consisting of vacant land owned by such city formerly known as Bennett's Lane Brooklyn, Greenwood & Bath Plank Road, designated as Block 6369, Lot 125 on the tax map of the city of New York for the borough of Brooklyn".
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: In rem, Bennett's Lane, Brooklyn (S.2669, A.8588)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Robach, Leibell, Marchi and Velella S.2765-B, and Committee on Rules, A.8401, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the twenty-five year/age fifty retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed in automotive positions".
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: 25 year/age 50 retirement program for members of the NYC employees' retirement system employed in automotive positions. (S.2765-B, A.8401)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4717-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8371-A, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the industrial and commercial incentive program".
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Industrial and commercial incentive program (S.4717-A, A.8371-A)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution of the Council of the City of New York, in relation to electing temporary exemptions and also a permanent exemption from local sales and compensating use taxes imposed by section 1107 of the New York Tax Law for receipts from retail sales of, and consideration given or contracted to be given for, certain clothing and footwear.
Items.MatterName: Electing temporary exemptions and permanent exemption from local sales and compensating use taxes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the Charter of the City of New York to provide the City Council with electronic access to the budget data used by the Office of Management and Budget to plan, track, and account for capital projects in the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: Provide the City Council with electronic access to the budget data used by OMB.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Robach, Leibell, Marchi and Velella S.2765-B, and Committee on Rules, A.8401, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the twenty-five year/age fifty retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed in automotive positions".
Items.MatterName: 25 year/age 50 retirement program for members of the NYC employees' retirement system employed in automotive positions. (S.2765-B, A.8401)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Golden, Maltese, Marchi and Velella, S.2564-A, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Cymbrowitz, Ortiz, Pheffer, Seddio, Seminerio and McLaughlin, et al, A.5464-A, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a twenty year retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as investigators by district attorneys' offices.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of  a twenty year retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as investigators by district attorneys' offices (S.2564-A, A.5464-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Golden, S.5326, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to failure of owners to remove graffiti from buildings".
Items.MatterName: Failure of owners to remove graffiti from buildings (S.5326)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Abbate, A.7163, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund".
Items.MatterName: Loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund (A.7163)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4717-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8371-A, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the industrial and commercial incentive program".
Items.MatterName: Industrial and commercial incentive program (S.4717-A, A.8371-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Morahan, S.5474, and Committee on Rules, A.8861, "AN ACT relating to providing a temporary retirement incentive to all members of the New York city employees' retirement system who joined such system on November 10, 1976 and at the date of their retirement, on June 11, 2002, received pension credit for 24.6 years of membership service".
Items.MatterName: Providing a temporary retirement incentive to all members of the New York city employees' retirement system (S.5474, A.8861)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Montgomery, S.5068-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8548-A, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to accept from Masjid At-Taqwa, Inc. an application for exemption from real property taxes".
Items.MatterName: Accept from Masjid At-Taqwa, Inc. an application for exemption from real property taxes (S.5068-A, A.8548-A)

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2004 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for any parcel where the annual real estate tax is more than $2,750 or where the real estate taxes are held in escrow and paid to the Commissioner of Finance by a mortgage escrow agent or where the parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land; and 9% per annum in all other cases.
Items.MatterName: Water and Sewer Rents, Interest Rates

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the discount rate for the prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at 2% per annum for Fiscal Year 2004.
Items.MatterName: Discount rate for the prepayment of real estate taxes be continued at 2% per annum for FY'04.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2004 for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax on the parcel is more than $2,750 or where, irrespective of the annual tax, the parcel consists of vacant or unimproved land; and for non-payment of charges for work performed pursuant to orders of the Board of Health or Department of Health and Mental Hygiene.
Items.MatterName: Orders of the Board of Health or Dept of Health, Interest Rates

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for non-payment of taxes on real property where the annual tax on the parcel, other than a parcel that consists of vacant or unimproved land, is not more than $2,750, be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2003 in the case of any such parcel where the real property taxes are held in escrow and paid to the Commissioner of Finance by a mortgage escrow agent; and 9% per annum in the case of all other such parcels.
Items.MatterName: Interest rate to be charged for FY'04 for non-payment of taxes on real property.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Downtown Flushing Transit Hub Business Improvement District in the Borough of Queens and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.MatterName: Downtown Flushing Transit Hub BID

Items.Title: The Acting Chairperson (Council Member Rivera) will adjourn the recessed meeting of June 5, 2003.
Items.MinutesNote: The Acting Chairperson (Council Member Rivera) adjourned the Recessed Meeting of June 5, 2003 held on June 12, 2003.

Items.Title: The Clerk will announce the presence of a quorum
Items.MinutesNote: The Clerk (Mr. Robles) announced the presence of a quorum.

Items.Title: Roll Call
Items.MinutesNote:
The Roll for Attendance for this Recessed Meeting was 50 Council Members Present 
Excused: Council Member Sanders.

The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) was not present at this Recessed Meeting. The Majority Leader (Council Member Rivera) assumed the Chair as the Acting Chairperson for these proceedings.

Items.Title: The Acting Chairperson  (Council Member Rivera) will call the meeting to order
Items.MinutesNote: The Acting Chairperson (Council Member Rivera) called the Recessed Meeting to order.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Abbate, A.4895, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed in police communications positions; and in relation to providing for employer pick up, pursuant to provisions of the internal revenue code, of certain additional member contributions required to be made by certain participants in the twenty-five year retirement programs".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the NYCERS employed in police communications positions (A.4895)

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to area eligibility limitations on benefits pursuant to section 421-a of the real property tax law.

Items.Title: Resolution of the Council of the City of New York, in relation to electing temporary exemptions and also a permanent exemption from local sales and compensating use taxes imposed by section 1107 of the New York Tax Law for receipts from retail sales of, and consideration given or contracted to be given for, certain clothing and footwear.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Electing temporary exemptions and permanent exemption from local sales and compensating use taxes.

Items.Title: Resolution of the Council of the City of New York, in relation to electing temporary exemptions and also a permanent exemption from local sales and compensating use taxes imposed by section 1107 of the New York Tax Law for receipts from retail sales of, and consideration given or contracted to be given for, certain clothing and footwear.
Items.MatterName: Electing temporary exemptions and permanent exemption from local sales and compensating use taxes.

Items.Title: Resolution opposing President Bush's FY 2004 budget proposal to eliminate the Section 8 Housing Voucher Choice program and replace it with block grants to the States and calling upon the New York State Congressional Delegation to oppose bills H.R. 1841 and S. 947, which would implement this proposal.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Opposing President Bush's FY 2004 budget proposal to eliminate the Section 8 Housing Voucher Choice program.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4717, and Committee on Rules, A.8371, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the industrial and commercial incentive program".
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Filed by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Industrial and commercial incentive program (S.4717, A.8371)
